<p><object data="http://www.twitch.tv/swflibs/TwitchPlayer.swf" height="378" id="clip_embed_player_flash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="420"><param name="movie" value="http://www.twitch.tv/swflibs/TwitchPlayer.swf"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><param name="allowNetworking" value="all"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="flashvars" value="channel=ksptv&auto_play=false&start_volume=25&videoId=a593733179&device_id=9b6d3ebe165a3320"></object><br/>Update 0.90 is fast approaching, so have some extra appreciation for where KSP’s roots and watch Maxmaps tackle some of the game’s earliest iterations on last week’s Squadcast.</p>

[]

Edited August 2, 2019 by CvVtjRtb
The clouds look lovely. Where have they gone now? And the water too.

Some thoughts after that nostalgic trip:

  • Parts popping off like dead weight is real funny. The current vaporizing disintegration thing we've got going now leaves no 'fruits of your failure'. I hope we see crumple/debris/scorch effects down the road, but meh, I'm not holding my breath.
  • Really, really glad all the textures have been changed over the versions. My eyes were burning through the whole video.
  • I think I understand now when the argument's made that too much analytic data makes the game more number-crunching and less a trial & error. The complete lack of tools made for some real interesting trial & error in the earliest versions. I'd argue quicksave & revert merely make for the lack of data frustrating rather than comical, as trial & error no longer comes with failure comedy just a reset, but that's up for debate.
  • God those textures.

The clouds look lovely. Where have they gone now? And the water too.

About a year or two ago, there was a reveal of 0.1 through 0.4 in screenshot form. These newsposts explained that the water and clouds both are Unity defaults, and that the clouds in particular wouldn't work in a properly 3D-camera-enabled scene.
That background should be a loading screen. It's really pretty.

That background should be a loading screen. It's really pretty.

Yes! What we really need in a new update is more loading screen pictures! They don't seem like something that would be hard to add anyway.
Yes! What we really need in a new update is more loading screen pictures! They don't seem like something that would be hard to add anyway.

Sorry for my ignorance but how do I watch these squadcasts? I've downloaded the twitch app but searches for squad, squadcast, and Kerbal do not reveal anything other than random Kerbal videos. There is no link that I can see in the above post. I've tried the link from the main page here but all I get is "not broadcasting." What is the secret? Thanks in advance.
The channel name is KSPTV. Squadcast is the name used for the recorded videos.

The channel name is KSPTV. Squadcast is the name used for the recorded videos.

Thanks. Now that I'm on my PC rather than iPad the video comes right up in this thread.

Hooray! Don't waste an hour of your day:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102079-Squadcast-Summary-%282014-12-06%29

ObsessedWithKSP did what Squad can't be bothered to do and wrote the information so you can read it in a couple of minutes. Literacy is a wonderful thing!

No wasted hour, no huge broadband bill, just communication.

Could we have a direct link to the page on twitch? Or even better a YouTube upload? I'd like to watch this but so much prefer YouTube to Twitch, but prefer actually watching on Twitch to watching a video linked to on the forum.

And nobody tell me just to check the archives. Twitch is such a horrible site I can't find anything once I get to ksptv. It just tells me it's currently offline.

Mornin'!

http://www.twitch.tv/ksptv/b/596126868

And please use Y to go to overwatch!

http://www.twitch.tv/ksptv/profile/pastBroadcasts here you go. It is indeed a bit hard to find these, since you need to go to the channel profile, then click the past broadcasts. Twitch isn't a video website after all, rather it's a live streaming website..
Man the water looked kind of awesome in those early versions.

And the fact that it's not meant for how it's used is just another reason the videos with important info should be on a service more tailored for that.
